newsitem.title: USA: Cadence to acquire High Level for stock.
newsitem.headline: Cadence to acquire High Level for stock.

text.p: Cadence Design Systems Inc said Thursday it had signed a definitive agreement to acquire High Level Design Systems Inc, a maker of advanced design technology for integrated circuits, or ICs.
Cadence will issue just over 2.55 million common shares and 616,000 employee stock options to acquire High Level, putting the deals value at about $94.1 million, it said.
Shares of High Level Design are traded on the Vancouver, Canada, stock exchange under the symbol HLD.U.
Cadence stock was up 1/2 at 37-3/8 after the deal's announcement.

"We have a clear vision of where the system-on-a-chip market is headed," Joseph Costello, Cadence chief executive said. "The only way to deliver a working solution for the unique requirements of this level of design is a combination of the 'best-in-class' technologies from Cadence and High Level Design."

The merger has been approved by the boards of both companies and is subject to approval by the shareholders of High Level Design. The deal calls for a tax-free, stock swap at a fixed ratio of 0.22 shares of Cadence common stock for each High Level Design share.
